title: Domain 2.3: Given a scenario, detect, remove, and prevent malware using the appropriate tools and methods.
content:
ü¶† Malware Types

  • Trojan: Disguises as legitimate software. Once run, it can steal data or create backdoors.
  • Rootkit: Grants unauthorized root/admin access and hides its presence. Very stealthy.
  • Virus: Attaches to legitimate files and spreads when those files are shared. Can damage or crash systems.
  • Spyware: Secretly collects user info, like browsing data or login credentials.
  • Ransomware: Encrypts files or locks systems until a ransom is paid.
  • Keylogger: Records every keystroke, often used to steal passwords or credit card data.
  • Boot Sector Virus: Infects the boot sector and activates during startup. Can prevent booting entirely.
  • Cryptominers: Uses system resources to mine cryptocurrency, slowing performance and damaging hardware.

üõ†Ô∏è Malware Detection & Prevention Tools

  • Recovery Mode: Safe environment to troubleshoot, restore, or repair malware-infected systems.
  • Antivirus: Scans for and removes known threats like viruses and worms. Needs frequent updates.
  • Anti-malware: Targets modern threats like spyware, ransomware, and rootkits.
  • Software Firewalls: Filters traffic and blocks suspicious connections.
  • Anti-phishing Training: Educates users to avoid malicious emails and websites.
  • User Education: Helps recognize common cyber threats and avoid risky behaviors.
  • OS Reinstallation: Wipes the system clean and removes stubborn infections. Back up data first.
